intro: Senecio columbianus, commonly known as the Colombian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Senecio columbianus is often found in montane regions and is adapted to thrive in cooler, humid climates.
